title: Making Sense of AI Benefits: A Mixed-method Study in Canadian Public Administration
technology_discussed: Artificial intelligence; Machine learning; Natural language processing
research_description: This paper explores factors that affect the sensemaking of AI benefits in Canadian public administration using mixed methods. The study includes a PLS-SEM analysis with 272 participants and interviews with 38 participants, investigating the effects of institutional pressures and consultant influence on AI adoption.
research_results: Service coercive pressures significantly impact perceived AI benefits, while consultant pressures are key drivers of institutional pressures. A sensemaking model is developed, showing how institutional pressures influence AI adoption.
future_research: Future research could explore AI adoption in different public sectors or expand the sensemaking model to other technology innovations.
